article.headline: Harvard 89, Brown 82
article.story: BOSTON -- Siyani Chambers scored 17 points and dished out 10 assists to help Harvard overcome Brown 89-82 in double overtime Saturday night to remain undefeated in Ivy League play. Wesley Saunders added 18 points while Laurent Rivard and Christian Webster tallied 16 apiece. Harvard (12-6, 4-0) led 69-64 with 20 seconds left before Sean McGonagill hit a 3-pointer with 14 seconds left, then converted a jumper at the buzzer to send the game into overtime. Brown (8-10, 2-2) fell behind 78-75 with 38 seconds left in the first OT, but Stephen Albrecht connected on a trey to knot it and send the game into the second overtime. Harvard outscored Brown 11-4 in the second overtime to seal the victory. The Bears missed three straight 3-pointers over the final 21 seconds of the second extra frame. McGonagill paced Brown with 20 points and played all 50 minutes of the contest.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
